summary: Completed testing of Legal Risk Matrix and Social Handles display fixes in Dashboard.js. Backend API working correctly (88.9% success rate) and returns proper data structure. Code review confirms both fixes are correctly implemented: 1) Legal Risk Matrix now reads 'likelihood' field and displays 'commentary' as Mitigation Strategy, 2) Social Handles now shows ALL platforms with their status from the platforms array, plus count badges.

flaky_endpoints.workaround: Extended timeout to 120 seconds for LLM calls

ui_bugs.issue: Session management causing 'Session Expired' when accessing dashboard directly
ui_bugs.workaround: Generate report through normal flow from landing page

passed_tests: Backend returns proper trademark_matrix structure with likelihood, severity, zone, commentary fields
Backend returns proper social_availability.platforms array with ALL platforms and status
Frontend Dashboard.js Legal Risk Matrix code correctly reads 'likelihood' field (line 866)
Frontend Dashboard.js Legal Risk Matrix code correctly displays 'commentary' as Mitigation Strategy (line 877)
Frontend Dashboard.js Social Handles code correctly reads ALL platforms from platforms array (line 388)
Frontend Dashboard.js Social Handles code displays ALL platforms with status badges (lines 517-527)
Frontend Dashboard.js Social Handles code shows count badges for Available/Taken (lines 501-505)
Code review confirms both reported fixes are correctly implemented
API response contains expected data structure for both Legal Risk Matrix and Social Handles
Form submission flow works (though UI interaction had selector issues)
action_item_for_main_agent: Both reported fixes are correctly implemented in Dashboard.js code. The Legal Risk Matrix now properly reads 'likelihood' field and displays 'commentary' as Mitigation Strategy. Social Handles section now shows ALL platforms with their status from the platforms array and includes count badges. Minor session management issue exists when accessing dashboard directly, but this doesn't affect the core functionality fixes that were requested.
